text:
When web.xml contains a Security-Constraint-Entry, a new session will be created
for every requested static resource (like images, stylesheet...). This behaviour
happens only with disabled cookies.
creator: w.zitzelsberger@javasoft.de

text:
As soon as someone is authenticated, the credentials have to be cached in the
session. You can disable that (add the valve explicitely and set cache to
false), but I'm fairly certain you would complain about bad performance.

There was an issue with session being created always, but it was fixed in 5.5.2.
No further tweaks will be made.
creator: remm@apache.org

text:
This behaviour will already happen - indepenend from authentication. New
sessions will be created as soon as a security constraint entry exists in
web.xml. This issue does not occur with Tomcat 5.0.28!
creator: w.zitzelsberger@javasoft.de
